meanings.definition: The quality of being impossible to understand or interpret.
meanings.sent1: Her inscrutability during the test left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The inscrutability of the ancient text baffled the historians.
meanings.sent3: The inscrutability of the magic trick made the audience gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: His inscrutability was like a locked chest, hiding its secrets from prying eyes.
meanings.sent5: The inscrutability of the code kept the hackers at bay.

meanings.definition: The state of being mysterious or enigmatic.
meanings.sent1: The inscrutability of the masked stranger intrigued the detective.
meanings.sent2: The inscrutability of the night sky filled her with wonder.
meanings.sent3: The inscrutability of the missing sock made her laugh at the absurdity.
meanings.sent4: The inscrutability of the ocean depths reminded him of the vast unknown.
meanings.sent5: The inscrutability of the old mansion sparked ghost stories among the children.
